vote.title: To authorize the Director of Recreation and Parks to record the Notice of Funding with the Franklin County Recorder, as required by the NatureWorks 2023 Procedural Reporting Guide; and to declare an emergency. ($0)
vote.description:
Explanation
 
Background: This ordinance authorizes the Director of Recreation and Parks to record the Notice of Funding with the Franklin County Recorder, as required by the NatureWorks 2023 Procedural Reporting Guide.
 
In June of 2020, the Recreation and Parks Department applied for grant funding through the Ohio Department of Natural Resources (ODNR) NatureWorks Program, as authorized by Ordinance 0804-2020, to support the Linview Park Project. In December of 2021, the Department received notice that the grant was approved. Legislation was submitted in April 2022 to enter into a grant agreement with ODNR, as authorized by Ordinance 1081-2022. Finalized construction plans were received in 2023 and the project was bid for construction in August 2023. The Recreation and Parks Department entered into contract with Builderscape, Inc. for the construction of the project, as authorized by Ordinance 2464-2023. This construction project was completed in November of 2024. 
 
The Recreation and Parks Department was recently advised by an ODNR representative that the Notice of Funding must be recorded with the Franklin County Recorder, as required by the NatureWorks 2023 Procedural Reporting Guide. This is needed in order to successfully receive grant reimbursement for the project and close out the grant. 
 
Principal Parties:
Ohio Department of Natural Resources 
2045 Morse Road
Columbus, Ohio 43229
Timothy Robinson, (614) 265-6528
Contract Compliance Number: 005089
Contract Compliance Expiration Date: N/A (State of Ohio Agency)     
 
Emergency Justification: Emergency action is requested to comply with ODNR's NatureWorks grant reporting requirements which will allow the Recreation and Parks Department to receive the grant reimbursement, complete final grant reporting, and to remain in good standing with ODNR as they have offered a grace period beyond the December 31, 2024 deadline of the grant agreement. 
 
Benefits to the Public: The near Northeast area of Columbus lacks adequate open spaces and parks. This park furthers the city’s goal of providing recreational areas and outdoor experiences for inner city neighborhoods. Over 6,000 residents live within a 10 minute walk of this project.
 
Community Input/Issues: Initial public engagement meetings took place throughout 2019 to survey residents and get input for features to be included in the park design.  Additional public meetings took place in February of 2022 to inform final design and desired park amenities.
 
Area(s) Affected: Northeast (41)
 
Master Plan Relation: This project will support the Recreation and Parks Master Plan by providing equitable and safe access to parks for underserved communities.
 
Fiscal Impact: No fiscal action is required at this time. 
Title
 
To authorize the Director of Recreation and Parks to record the Notice of Funding with the Franklin County Recorder, as required by the NatureWorks 2023 Procedural Reporting Guide; and to declare an emergency. ($0)
 
Body
 
WHEREAS, it is necessary to authorize the Director of Recreation and Parks to record the Notice of Funding with the Franklin County Recorder, as required by the NatureWorks 2023 Procedural Reporting Guide; and 
 
WHEREAS, an emergency exists in the usual daily operations of the Recreation and Parks Department in that it is immediately necessary to authorize the Director of Recreation and Parks to record the Notice of Funding with the Franklin County Recorder, as required by the NatureWorks 2023 Procedural Reporting Guide, to comply with ODNR's NatureWorks grant reporting requirements which will allow the Recreation and Parks Department to receive the grant reimbursement, complete final  grant reporting, and to remain in good standing with ODNR as they have offered a grace period beyond the December 31, 2024 deadline of the grant agreement, all for the immediate preservation of the public health, peace, property, safety, and welfare and, NOW, THEREFORE
 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS:
 
SECTION 1. That the Director of Recreation and Parks be and is hereby authorized to record the Notice of Funding with the Franklin County Recorder, as required by the NatureWorks 2023 Procedural Reporting Guide, for the Linview Park Project. 
 
SECTION 2. That for the reasons stated in the preamble hereto, which is hereby made a part hereof, this ordinance is hereby declared to be an emergency measure and shall take effect and be in force from and after its passage and approval by the Mayor, or ten days after passage if the Mayor neither approves nor vetoes the same.
